title: What would a Labour government under Corbyn mean for house prices?
text:
Something bigger than Brexit is brewing that could completely transform the property market, upending forecasts while sending house prices "rapidly falling". That radical force? Jeremy Corbyn.

The Labour Party hasn’t released a formal manifesto, but it's possible to piece together the housing policies it has so far discussed. These property plans are radical, numerous and, as the likelihood of an election looms, increasingly possible.

So, what could a Jeremy Corbyn-led government mean for house prices in Britain?

Your house is no longer an asset

The Labour Party has argued that property should no longer be seen as a financial asset, and the government should take steps stabilise house price growth....
description: Something bigger than Brexit is brewing that could completely transform the property market, upending forecasts while sending house prices "rapidly falling".
